title: Blank White Screen Testing Exposes Firefox 89 Scrolling Issues
content:
Hi everyone,

Blank white full screen testing has been a game changer in identifying display issues like flickering and tearing. After upgrading to Firefox 89, I used a white full screen to pinpoint significant issues during scrolling on my MacBook Pro (2022 - macOS 13 Ventura) with an external LG screen over USB-C. This method made the inconsistencies highly visible.

When I reverted to Firefox 88, the issue disappeared, but it returned with 89, even after trying a new profile.

Additionally, I noticed that scrolling via the Mac trackpad starts laggy and only speeds up after the first scroll.

For now, I have reverted to Firefox 88, but I'm wondering if anyone else has faced these problems or found a fix?
